IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: TO PROVIDE MEMBERS WITH A FORUM TO BUY, SELL, AND MARKET PRODUCTS AND SERVICES WHICH DRIVE THE SPECIALTY AUTOMOTIVE AFTERMARKET.
IRS990.MissionDescription: FOR OVER 40 YEARS, THE SPECIALTY EQUIPMENT MARKET ASSOCIATION HAS SERVED AS THE SOLE GUIDING FORCE BEHIND THE EXTRAORDINARY GROWTH AND SUCCESS OF THE SPECIALTY AUTOMOTIVE AFTERMARKET - A UNIQUE INDUSTRY DEDICATED TO THE ENHANCED PERFORMANCE, APPEARANCE AND HANDLING OF THE 20TH CENTURY'S GREATEST INNOVATION: THE AUTOMOBILE. DURING THOSE YEARS, SEMA HAS MATURED FROM AN UPSTART COALITION OF INNOVATIVE ENTREPRENEURS TO AN ESTABLISHED BUSINESS FORCE WHOSE IMPACT IS FELT BY EVERY SEGMENT OF THE MARKETPLACE AS WELL AS THE LEGISLATIVE BODIES WHICH GOVERN IT. WHETHER IT HAS BEEN THROUGH PROVIDING OUR MEMBERS WITH AN UNRIVALED FORUM TO BUY, SELL AND MARKET PRODUCTS AND SERVICES WHICH HAVE DRIVEN THIS INDUSTRY - THE SEMA SHOW; LEGAL PROTECTION TO ENSURE THAT MEMBERS' DOORS REMAIN OPEN TO DO WHAT THEY DO BEST - BUSINESS; OR OUR VALUABLE MENU OF BENEFITS WHICH HELP MEMBERS IMPROVE THEIR DAY TO DAY BUSINESS AND MARKETING ACTIVITIES, SEMA HAS BEEN THERE SINCE THE BEGINNING AS THE ONLY ASSOCIATION DED

Form990ScheduleCPartIV.Explanation: SPECIALTY EQUIPMENT MARKET ASSOCIATION FEDERAL POLITICAL ACTION COMMITTEE The D.C. office lobbies in all 50 states, U.S. Congress and with administrative regulatory agencies. Lobbying activity includes writing letters, engaging grass-roots participating coalitions, and face-to-face meetings with legislators and regulators. The committee may contribute to campaign funds to support individual candidates who are supportive of the specialty automotive aftermarket industry. SPECIALTY EQUIPMENT MARKET ASSOCIATION CALIFORNIA POLITICAL ACTION COMMITTEE The D.C. office monitors legislation at both the federal and state levels. The committee may contribute to campaign funds to support individual candidates who are supportive of the specialty automotive aftermarket industry.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Identifier: FUNDRAISING EVENT DIRECT REVENUE AND EXPENSES
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: PART XII, LINE 2D AND PART XIII, LINE 2D
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: Amounts reclassed for tax purposes. Total amount from reclasses nets to zero.

Effective July 1, 2009, the Company adopted the provisions of ASC Topic 740, Income Taxes, as it relates to accounting for uncertainties in income taxes. This guidance prescribes a recognition threshold and a measurement attribute for the financial statement recognition and measurement of tax positions taken or expected to be taken in a tax return. It also provides guidance on derecognition, classification, interest and penalties, disclosures and transition on uncertain tax positions. For these tax benefits to be recognized, a tax position must be more-likely-than-not to be sustained upon the examination by taxing authorities. Differences between the amounts reported as a result of adoption are accounted for as a cumulative effect adjustment recorded to net assets as of July 1, 2009. The adoption of this guidance did not result in an adjustment to beginning net assets as there were no uncertain tax positions identified as of July 1, 2009 or June 30, 2010.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: THE ASSOCIATION PAYS COACH AIRFARE FOR THE PRESIDENT'S SPOUSE TO TRAVEL TO MEETINGS. REIMBURSEMENT PROVIDED UPON PROOF OF EXPENSE INCURRED.

GeneralExplanation.Explanation: INDIVIDUALS OF THE MEMBER COMPANIES CAN BE NOMINATED TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. NO INDIVIDUAL MEMBER COMPANY HAS A RIGHT TO RECEIVE DISTRIBUTIONS OF INCOME FROM THE ASSOCIATION, OR ASSETS OF THE ORGANIZATION. SHOULD THE ORGANIZATION DISSOLVE, THEN ANY REMAINING ASSETS WOULD GO TO ANOTHER 501(C)(6) CORPORATION.
Except for Supporting Members, all members are eligible to vote in the annual elections if their dues are current.

The Board of Directors may offer any proposals to Members for consideration and voting by mail, when it appears inadvisable or impractical to call a special meeting for such purpose. The question thus stated and submitted by the Board shall be determined according to a majority of the votes received from the Active Members by mail within thirty (30) days after the mailing thereof to the Members, provided that in each case the votes of at least onE-third of the Active Members shall be received. Any and all action taken in pursuance of any such mail vote shall be binding upon the Association.

The SEMA governing body has authorized the Audit Review Committee to review and approve the Form 990. The Form 990 is prepared by an accounting firm. A draft copy is submitted to the Audit Review Committee for review and approval. Once approved, the President/CEO signed the Form 990 and an electronic copy is filed with the IRS.
The Directors are required to fill out a conflict of interest form annually, and are requested to report any new conflicts at the quarterly Board of Directors Meetings.
The compensation for the President/CEO is determined by the compensation committee. THE REVIEW IS BASED ON DATA OBTAINED THROUGH OUTSIDE RESEARCH.
ALL DOCUMENTS ARE MADE AVAILABLE WITHIN THIRTY (30) DAYS OF A WRITTEN REQUEST.
